column4: but as an FYI I dont think that 2nd line is going to execute unless you throw a ./ infront of ioUrbanTeorr.i386

that's definitely not going to change anything :)
what wont?
the ./
- ...?  Pull up a terminal... edit a file and save it as blarp.sh...          ./blarp.sh
no
./foo means specifying a path
no, you told him to add a stupid extra ./ in the middle of a path which won't change anything
- yes it will... its saying in that path to execute that script
please take linux lessons. The stupidity is radiating from you :)

- read up on executing scripts... it worked for him.  Apparently my "stupidity" helps people. :)
